about.title: A Comprehensive Cancer Care Approach
about.description: Bangladesh Cancer Aid Trust (BANCAT) is a community-driven organization providing care beyond treatment through awareness, advocacy, facilitated cancer scopes, and a safe sanctuary of support for patients and their families.
about.journey_title: Our Story: The Journey of BANCAT
about.journey_text_1: The Bangladesh Cancer Aid Trust (BANCAT) began as a personal mission of resilience. In 2011, founder Najmus Ahmed Albab was diagnosed with cancer, an experience that transformed his personal battle into a vision to ensure no one fights cancer alone. This led to the 2015 establishment of the Bangladesh Cancer Aid Foundation (BANCAF), which provided critical rehabilitation and financial aid to hundreds of patients through community collaboration.
about.journey_text_2: In July 2019, the organization transitioned into BANCAT, marking a significant expansion in outreach and professional care. Despite the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic, BANCAT intensified its efforts, distributing thousands of food aid packages to hospitals. A historic milestone was reached in 2022 with the founding of Alok Nibash, the country’s first holistic cancer care home. Today, BANCAT has evolved from a grassroots initiative into a nationwide force for advocacy, providing free medical treatment, accommodation, and emotional support to thousands of "cancer warriors."
about.vision_desc: To advance societal impact through compassionate, community-driven cancer care and support.
about.mission_desc: Develop a cancer well-being ecosystem in Bangladesh.

team.title: Meet Our Team
team.subtitle: The dedicated individuals driving our mission forward.
team.intro: BANCAT is led by a multidisciplinary collective of healthcare advocates, professionals, survivors, and volunteers. Guided by a distinguished Board of Trustees, our team works at the intersection of medical aid and community service to ensure that every "cancer warrior" receives holistic care and dignified support.

founder.name: Najmus Ahmed Albab
founder.bio_1: A social entrepreneur and cancer survivor, Najmus Ahmed Albab founded BANCAT to transform the cancer care experience in Bangladesh. His firsthand journey inspired a mission to bridge systemic healthcare gaps, leading to the establishment of Mosabbir Alok Nibash—the nation's first holistic care sanctuary.
founder.bio_2: With 25 years of leadership expertise, Mr. Albab focuses on fostering strategic partnerships and scaling the "Care is Cure" model to ensure that no one faces the challenges of cancer alone.
founder.quote: "Our Vision 2030 is to establish a global standard for compassionate, community-led cancer aid."

team.trustees_subtitle: Guiding our vision with expertise and integrity.
team.ambassadors_subtitle: Voices amplifying our cause across the nation.

rabbi.title: HELP RABBI
rabbi.description: My three year old son, Rabbi, is a stage 3 cancer patient. When he was first diagnosed, our entire world turned upside down. We did not have the financial means to fight this battle on our own. BANCAT stepped in to help cover critical support when we needed it most. Rabbi's Mother

volunteer.title: Become a Volunteer
volunteer.intro: Join BANCAT as a volunteer and contribute to the global fight against cancer. By signing up, you will participate in diverse initiatives designed to provide critical care to patients throughout every stage of their treatment. Your involvement will also play a vital role in raising public awareness and fostering collaboration among organizations dedicated to this cause. Seize this opportunity to make a lasting impact and improve the lives of millions of cancer patients in Bangladesh and beyond.
volunteer.terms_title: By registering as a volunteer with BANCAT, the applicant agrees to adhere to the following terms and conditions:

terms.values_desc: The volunteer must strictly adhere to the core principles, mission, and ethical standards of BANCAT.
terms.commitment_desc: The applicant affirms a genuine interest in service-oriented initiatives and a commitment to advancing the organization’s humanitarian goals.
terms.probono_desc: All volunteer services are performed voluntarily. The applicant acknowledges that they shall receive no salary, wages, or financial remuneration of any kind in exchange for their services.
terms.integrity_desc: The volunteer is expected to maintain the highest standards of integrity and trustworthiness. This includes the responsible management of resources and the faithful execution of assigned duties during project implementation.

alok_nibash_page.hero_subtitle: A Heaven for the Terminally Ill — adding life to days when days can't be added to life.
alok_nibash_page.about_title: A Home for Dignity and Peace
alok_nibash_page.about_p1: Mosabbir Alok Nibash is Bangladesh’s first holistic cancer care facility, a manifestation of the "Care is Cure" idea. It started off as a result of the powerful merger of BANCAT’s original Alok Nibash and the Mosabbir Cancer Care Centre (MCCC). MCCC was established in 2004 in memory of 17-year-old Mosabbir Hossain Khan. This facility is providing a lifeline for underserved cancer warriors every day.
alok_nibash_page.about_p2: From a 24-bed home in 2022, Mosabbir Alok Nibash has now expanded into an 85-bed facility through a strategic partnership with the Mosabbir Memorial Foundation. In its inaugural year alone, it served approximately 350 patients, offering them a dignified environment to heal.
alok_nibash_page.mission_desc: Our mission is to transform "despairing mortals into promising lives" by addressing the physical, emotional, and socio-economic gaps in cancer care.
alok_nibash_page.closing_statement: At Mosabbir Alok Nibash, we ensure that no one has to fight cancer alone, providing a nurturing community that restores hope during life's most difficult moments.
alok_nibash_page.services_subtitle: Comprehensive care designed for comfort and quality of life.
alok_nibash_page.service_1_desc: We provide free accommodation, nutritious food, and transportation for patients and their caregivers.
alok_nibash_page.service_2_desc: Beyond clinical treatment, we offer around-the-clock medical supervision, mental health counseling, and wellness training.
alok_nibash_page.sponsor_title: Adopt a Room, Adopt a Life
alok_nibash_page.sponsor_desc: You can sponsor a bed or an entire room at Alok Nibash to ensure a patient receives food, medicine, and care for free. Your contribution gives them a peaceful ending.
alok_nibash_page.admission_eligibility_desc: Patients with advanced terminal illness (Stage 4) where curative treatment is no longer effective.
alok_nibash_page.admission_referral_desc: Must be referred by a registered oncologist with medical history.
alok_nibash_page.admission_cost_desc: Service is completely FREE for financially underprivileged patients.

alok_katha_page.hero_subtitle: Weaving stories of life in every stitch.
alok_katha_page.about_p1: Alok Katha is a creative platform of BANCAT focused on the psychological and economic rehabilitation of cancer survivors. The program addresses the "hidden" side of cancer—the loss of identity and financial stability. By providing a platform for skill-building and income generation, Alok Katha transforms fabric remnants into symbols of resilience. This is also a place where people can share their stories and experiences through a creative and productive channel. Alok Katha empowers survivors and their families by teaching ethical craftsmanship, with a specific focus on repurposing fabric scraps through zero-waste embroidery techniques.
alok_katha_page.about_p2: This initiative demonstrates that productivity is a form of healing, allowing patients and caregivers alike to transition from "patienthood" back into being active, empowered, and independent individuals that they are. Every handcrafted piece tells a story of survival, ensuring that the "Care is Cure" philosophy translates into tangible financial independence and renewed self-worth for those navigating the aftermath of the disease.

alokon_page.hero_subtitle: A Mental Wellness Haven for the Cancer Community.
alokon_page.about_p1: Alokon is the practical manifestation of BANCAT’s commitment to holistic recovery, recognizing that cancer’s impact extends far beyond physical health. It serves as a dedicated "Mental Wellness Haven," addressing the emotional and psychological well-being of patients, families, and caregivers.
alokon_page.about_p2: Alokon integrates professional counseling and mental wellness support to contribute directly to cancer prevention, early detection, and improved health outcomes, bridging the gap in traditional oncological care.
alokon_page.service_1_desc: Individual, group, and family sessions with oncology-trained psychologists to manage stress, trauma, and grief.
alokon_page.service_2_desc: Evidence-based evaluations to provide personalized support paths.
alokon_page.service_3_desc: Access to the Cancer Warrior Club, a trusted network for sharing experiences.
alokon_page.service_4_desc: Training for caregivers and corporate teams on emotional resilience and burnout prevention.
alokon_page.service_5_desc: Continuous empowerment through follow-up check-ins and updated resources.
alokon_page.payment_desc: Alokon employs an innovative sliding-scale payment model based on income to ensure accessibility. This inclusive approach allows service fees to be adjusted based on an individual’s financial capacity, ensuring that high-quality psychological support remains accessible and affordable for everyone in the cancer community, regardless of their economic background.

alok_boshoti_page.hero_subtitle: A Vision for Dignified Care — Creating Bangladesh's First Cancer Care Village.
alok_boshoti_page.about_p1: Alok Boshoti is the flagship initiative of BANCAT, embodying its long-term vision to revolutionize oncology with the creation of Bangladesh’s first-ever "Cancer Care Village." Less than 1% cancer patients receive proper palliative care; many others suffer because of logistical issues, not being able to travel, or stay near hospitals. This initiative addresses the severe shortage of specialized residential facilities for those battling the disease. It integrates medical necessity with a care-economy model, ensuring that the environment itself serves as a fundamental pillar of the healing process.
alok_boshoti_page.about_p2: The project features a state-of-the-art 250-bed capacity and is being implemented in five distinct phases over a 37-month timeline. Alok Boshoti is designed to be a self-sustaining and eco-friendly project, incorporating solar energy and organic farming into its infrastructure.
alok_boshoti_page.service_1_desc: Specialized units providing compassionate end-of-life care.
alok_boshoti_page.service_2_desc: Advanced facilities for early detection and diagnosis.
alok_boshoti_page.service_3_desc: Dedicated spaces for spiritual and mental wellness.
alok_boshoti_page.vision_desc: Once fully operational, Alok Boshoti aims to serve over 5,000 patients annually, significantly closing the "Cancer Care Gap" in Bangladesh. By offering free treatment, nutritional support, and therapeutic services, the village provides a much-needed lifeline for underserved families who would otherwise be unable to afford long-term palliative care.
alok_boshoti_page.impact_desc: Alok Boshoti represents a new chapter in the nation's healthcare history, transforming the "agony" of cancer into a narrative of realistic hope. It is a beacon of community resilience, proving that through collective philanthropy and sustainable planning, we can build a future where every patient receives dignified care. As the cornerstone of BANCAT’s Vision 2030, Alok Boshoti is our commitment to ensuring that no cancer warrior is left to fight their battle alone.
